rationale: This 8-bar arrangement uses only triads (capped jazz_harmony at 3/10) and lacks 7th chords or functional harmony. The hihat plays exclusively on downbeats (capped latin_jazz_rhythm at 3/10), resulting in a straight-time swing feel rather than Latin jazz. The saxophone melody has some rests but lacks phrasing and bebop vocabulary (5/10). The arrangement starts with all instruments playing together (interplay_space capped at 4/10), missing the progressive build characteristic of jazz. The overall feel is academic and stiff (5/10), lacking the spontaneity and soul of authentic jazz. Needs 7th chords, stronger upbeat syncopation, and a more dynamic arrangement structure.
suggestions: Bar 1: ONLY hihat should play. All other instruments rest.
Bars 2-4: Add snare and bass. Piano and sax still rest.
Bars 5-8: Full ensemble enters with piano 7th chords and memorable sax melody.
Replace ALL piano triads with 7th chords (e.g., Cmaj7, Dm7, G7). In bar 1, replace C-E-G-B with Cmaj7. In bar 2, replace D-F-A with Dm7.
Rewrite hihat pattern to emphasize upbeats: hit on 'and' of 1, 'and' of 2, 'and' of 3, and 'and' of 4. Target >60% upbeat placement.
prompt_mutation: Emphasize progressive arrangement structure more strongly. Add quantitative requirements: Bar 1 = hihat ONLY, Bars 2-4 = rhythm section ONLY (no piano/sax), Bars 5-8 = full ensemble. Make it impossible to ignore.
